title: Looking for ornamental woodcut-style Hebrew letters
content:
I am looking everywhere for vector images of the full Hebrew alphabet in ornamental woodcut style lettering similar to the first words of seforim printed by the Soncino family. Any ideas where I could find something like this?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Page%207%20(Medium)_4502.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Page%2071%20(Medium)_5875.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Page%20289%20(Medium)_4918.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114612im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Page%20296%20(Medium)_6242.jpg)
author: dov717

comments.content:
Seems like a long-shot.  
Also, the extreme level of detail here means most people who attempt to convert these to beziér curves will end up with low-quality results. It's not easy doing a clean job of this sort of thing.

But in any case, good luck.

hhp
